title: Sveriges Radio P3
text:
P3 ("Sveriges Radio P3" or "pe tre") is a <a href="Contemporary%20hit%20radio">mainstream CHR</a>-formatted station operated by <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a>'s national publicly funded radio broadcasting organization <a href="Sveriges%20Radio">Sveriges Radio</a>. Its output (pop, rock, hip-hop and dance) is oriented towards young people from <a href="h%C3%B6gstadiet">junior high school</a> age to 35. The P in P3 originally stood for Program ("Programme") but today has no official meaning and is simply a name.
P3 is broadcast nationwide on <a href="FM%20broadcasting">FM</a> (also digitally via <a href="Digital%20Audio%20Broadcasting">DAB</a> in <a href="Stockholm">Stockholm</a>, <a href="Gothenburg">Gothenburg</a>, <a href="Malm%C3%B6">Malmö</a>, and <a href="Lule%C3%A5">Luleå</a>) as well as being streamed on the <a href="internet">internet</a>. It also operated the web- and DAB-only channel P3 Star until June 2019.
The station claims that it plays 1,200 different songs every week and at least 1/3 of them are Swedish. It also welcomes musical suggestions from listeners and records from unsigned/independent artists.
Current programmes.
As well as its music programming, P3 also provides a <a href="traffic%20message%20channel">traffic message channel</a> service.
